result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis X. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $955  plus surcharges.  Joint & severally w/ co defts.
May not have contact with Rayshaun J, Everett R, victim, or known felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Amended Assmt Report
Joint & Several Restitution
review requested for restitution ordered here and joint & several box of jclerk
Amended Assmt Report

Restitution Determined - $955.00 Joint & Several w/ ER, RL
This total does not include 10% surcharge due Kenosha Co. Clerk of Courts.
For Restitution Order
Presentence incarceration credit.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 15 years WSP concurrent with 14CF1336 & IL 14CF1584; 10 years initial confinement w/credit for 119 days served; 5 years initial confinement w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $955.00 (by stipulation of deft); extradition costs ordered in the amount of $498.04 (by stipulation of deft); any inmate account is subject to collection of restitution.
With Atty Michel the SEH of 5/29/15 at 9am is rescheduled, as that date does not give PSI writer enough time to complete investigation; reset to 6/15/15 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 5/29/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case may resolve.  PLEAH set for 4/22/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Bill Michel. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Further proceedings on 3-6-15 @ 8:45am with co-def 14CF1339. DAPT on 3-20-15 @ 1:30pm. Jury selection on 4-27-15 @ 9:00am. Jury trial on 4-28-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
William Michel

1:07 pm    Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matt Perz.  Clerk: LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on .2-25-15 @ 9:15 am.  $25000 cash bond set with conditions.

*No Contact w/ Everett D R, Rayshaun L J, Timothy & Aimee K or any of their residences.
